attributes.action: Make it illegal for airlines to over book.
attributes.additional_details:
If someone buys an airline ticket then that seat reservation should belong to whoever bought it in first place and only that person. 
Although consumer rights normally protect buyers, in this case it seems open to exploitation by the airlines.   
Extra tickets are sold on the assumption that some people may miss their flight but when no one misses a flight, the rightful owner could find themselves without a seat.
attributes.background:
Authorities should not allow airlines to re-sell tickets already purchased, at the moment airlines are allowed to overbook an airplane and re-allocate people at their convenience. 
Holidays are ruined by a dishonest and misleading service.

rejection.details:
